RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduado em Cincias Biolgicas pela Universidade Federal da Bahia em 2009. Mestre (2012) e Doutor (2018) em Ecologia: Teoria, Aplicao e Valores, pela mesma instituio. Mergulhador NAUI. Atua na rea de ecologia e conservao de ecossistemas marinhos. Apresenta vasta experincia em expedies oceanogrficas. Atualmente, desenvolve trabalhos que investigam o efeito de impactos antrpicos locais e das mudanas climticas globais em ecossistemas marinhos, atravs de abordagens observacionais, experimentais e de modelagem numrica. Em parceria com pesquisadores da Universidade Federal da Bahia e tambm de outros centros de pesquisa no Brasil e no exterior, vem atuando em estudos sobre ecologia microbiana, investigando especialmente a estruturao e funcionamento de microbiomas e os servios ecossistmicos oferecidos, frente aos impactos antrpicos, em ecossistemas marinhos de grande relevncia ecolgica, tais como os recifes de corais, os manguezais, os bancos de gramas marinhas e a regio Antrtica.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Extensive experience in oceanographic cruises, working in several fields to collect physical, chemical, geological and biological data. Experience with diving in different situations (exposed coasts, estuaries, rivers, surf zones and coral reefs) with more than 500 hours of diving. Extensive experience with small draft boats in estuaries, rivers, coral reefs and other coastal environments. Throughout his academic career he developed technologies for Brazilian coral cultivation 'ex situ', which enabled the researcher to develop ecological manipulative experiments in microcosms

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Ecologia de Recifes de Corais e Mudanas Climticas Globais
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA:
Avaliar a resposta de organismos recifais e da comunidade recifal s variaes ambientais de frequncias diversas e em escalas desde local a regional, em especial aquelas associadas a variaes na temperatura da gua do mar. Utilizao de componentes do recife (corais, sedimento) como indicadores de parmetros ambientais. 
Grande rea: Cincias Exatas e da Terra / rea: Biologia / Subrea: Ecologia. 
Setores de atividade: Produtos e Servios Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteo do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: LABORATRIO DE RECIFES DE CORAIS E MUDANAS GLOBAIS (RECOR)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PELD sitio 29 - Investigation of the functioning of the reef ecosystem in the coastal zone of the state of Bahia and evaluation of the effects of anthropogenic actions and global changes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The overall objective of the project is to monitor, in the long term, the functioning of the reef ecosystem in the coastal zone of the state of Bahia to assess: a) the effects of sea temperature rise related to global climate change - on photosymbiont organisms corals, whose loss causes bleaching; b) the ability of these corals to tolerate and / or acclimate to these sudden environmental changes (resilience), and c) changes in the structure of the reef-building communities as a result of impacts of natural origin or caused by anthropogenic actions
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: PELD sitio 29 - Investigao do funcionamento do ecossistema recifal da zona costeira do estado da Bahia e avaliao dos efeitos de aes antropognicas e mudanas globais

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SYnergies through Merging BIOlogical and biogeochemical expertise in COral REsearch - SymBioCore
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project aims to establish a multidisciplinary initiative to strengthen existing collaborative connections and establish new collaborations in the field of coral research and to promote the exchange of knowledge and expertise. The partners are at the frontier of research in their respective areas, of coral photobiology, regulation of photosynthesis, metabolism of coral symbiosis and genomic approach to photo-acclimatization and coral bleaching patterns; in addition to the ecophysiology of corals and biogeochemical processes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SYnergies through Merging BIOlogical and biogeochemical expertise in COral REsearch - SymBioCore

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Environmental Supervision Program - Complementation of Dredging and Deepening of the Port of Salvador Cais de gua de Meninos (TECON) - Subproject Benthic Communities of the Consolidated Substrate
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Coordinate and implement the integration of the various approaches of Environmental Monitoring to be developed, in accordance with the licensing conditions of the Environmental Agency of the State of Bahia - INEMA, for the execution of the complementation of the enterprise in the Organized Port of Salvador - Cais de gua de Meninos (TECON)

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Programa de Ps Graduao em Ecologia e Biomonitoramento

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Monitoring of ichthyofauna associated with estuarine environments on the Paraguau River / Todos os Santos Bay: bathymetric distribution and energy transfer between habitats
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Started in 2009, the ichthyofauna monitoring program of the Rio Paraguau estuary, the largest estuary on the coast of Bahia, seeks to identify patterns of use and occupation associated with natural events (eg tidal cycle, seasonality, preference for habitats, trophic patterns and reproductive cycles) and anthropogenic events (flow control imposed by the hydroeletric plants immediately upstream of the estuary, implementation of a shipyard near the mouth, marginal silting and the effect of overfishing). In addition, an investigation based on the bathymetric distribution of the ichthyofauna and the level of energy transfer between shallow and deep habitats is part of the monitoring scope. This program is logistically supported by Estaleiro Enseada do Paraguau, by the companies Biomonitoramento e Meio Ambiente and ICHTUS environmental solutions. In the academic segment, CAPES (Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel) has supported with a master's scholarship for Jos Amorim dos Reis Filho and the Federal University of Bahia has allowed students to develop their coursework with the data and hypotheses generated .
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Monitoramento da ictiofauna estuarina do Rio Paraguau - Baa de Todos os Santos: distribuio batimtrica e transferncia de energia entre os habitats

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Jos de Anchieta da Costa Cintra Nunes

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Monitoring of Fishing Activity of the Paraguau River Estuary, Todos os Santos Bay - Bahia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Started in 2012, the Fishing Activity Monitoring Program of the estuary of the Paraguau River, the largest estuary on the coast of Bahia, seeks to identify patterns and processes associated with the fishing dynamics of the estuary, from the sweet region to the adjacent external region and with a strong influence of this system . Fisheries monitoring takes place daily in 11 communities distributed along the saline gradient and that can express a large part of the diversity of artifacts, techniques and types of fisheries, target groups and relations of use with the estuarine environment. This program is logistically supported by Estaleiro Enseada do Paraguau, by the companies Biomonitoramento e Meio Ambiente and ICHTUS environmental solutions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Monitoramento da Atividade Pesqueira do Esturio do Rio Paraguau , Baa de Todos os Santos - Bahia

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Jos de Anchieta da Costa Cintra Nunes

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: LABORATRIO DE RECIFES DE CORAIS E MUDANAS GLOBAIS (RECOR)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Monitoring the effects of global warming on the reef ecosystem on the east coast of Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Understanding the response to bleaching, among the different species of dominant corals in the construction of the reef structure in Bahia, is the main objective of this research. This answer can only be obtained through data monitored for a long period. Data on the vitality conditions of the reefs in Bahia date back to 2000 and the continuity in obtaining these data will provide us with important indicators that will serve as predictive models both for the reefs that will be most affected by future bleaching events as well as for those who may become resistant, adapted or acclimated to the impact

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Zelinda Margarida de Andrade Nery Leo
Marlia de Dirceu Machado de Oliveira

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Geocincias, Departamento de Oceanografia

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Construction of functional models for phase shifts in coral reefs in Todos os Santos Bay
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In view of the extensive degradation of coral reefs, the creation of functional models becomes imperative. These models show ecological processes that lead to phase shifts in a given ecosystem. This information can help in making decisions about management measures, both for the prevention of further degradation and for the recovery of these ecosystems. The objective of this project is to develop functional models for two types of phase shift, the macroalgae domain and the zoanthid domain that were confirmed in reefs in the Todos os Santos Bay, Bahia-Brazil. For these models, it is necessary to identify and test the ecological processes that led to the reduction of coral cover and, preferably, they will identify the disturbance that triggers this phenomenon

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Biologia, Laboratrio de Ecologia Microbiana e Bioinformtica

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Impacts of climate change on microbiome, carbon fixation and water quality in aquifers
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In the future, climate change will impact groundwater quality and availability. Despite the importance of groundwater in carbon sequestration, studies on groundwater microbial communities and their contribution to the carbon budget are scarce. Information embedded in bacterial genomes can be used to understand their role in the carbon cycle, and their potential to mitigate climate change by absorbing carbon and restoring water quality in aquifers and reservoirs. In this work, we aim to study the microbial communities of Brazilian aquifers, their role in carbon sequestration and the potential effects of climate change on microbial diversity and carbon intake. We will assess the microbial diversity of aquifers through metagenomics and build an ecological niche model for aquifer?s bacterial communities. Using publicly available metagenomic datasets, combined with environmental parameters, we will build and validate models through measurative experiments. We will then empirically test the effects of climate changes on the aquifers microbial communities? structure and their ability to fix carbon through manipulative experiments. Finally, we will provide scientific information that will directly impact groundwater resources management. Our models will be applied to other aquifers, and greater understanding of microbial communities ecological services may be applied for bioremediation and restoration of water quality in aquifers

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: LABORATRIO DE RECIFES DE CORAIS E MUDANAS GLOBAIS (RECOR)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: INCT - Tropical Marine Environments - GT1.3 - Coral Reefs and Ecosystems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The INCT AmbTropic is a joint initiative of the Federal Universities of Bahia and Pernambuco and includes approximately 200 scientists distributed in more than 20 teaching and research institutions that share this vision. The resources for its implementation come from CNPq, FAPESB and CAPES. It is coordinated by professors Jos Maria Landim Dominguez (UFBA) and Sigrid Neumann Leito (UFPE), based at the UFBA Geosciences Institute. It has a central unifying objective to assess how the spatio-temporal heterogeneity of tropical marine environments can determine response of these environments and their resilience to climate changes that will affect the north-northeast of Brazil in this century. This aspect is of great strategic importance for the region. GT1.3, coordinated by Profa. Zelinda Leo and Prof Ruy Kenji Papa de Kikuchi, the general objective of this research group is to assess the vulnerability and resilience of coral reefs and ecosystems in northeastern Brazil, their integrity and ecosystemic connectivity, in order to identify resilient and vulnerable reefs, complemented with biomineralization studies calcifying organisms. Thus, the aim is to achieve a better understanding of the processes responsible for the changes that exist in Brazil's reef biota so that we can make predictions about the effects of global warming on these ecosystems and minimize their deterioration. Three lines of research will be studied during the development of the project, each of which has a specific objective: 1. vulnerability and and reef resilience; 2. biomineraizao of calcifying organisms and 3. Adaptation strategies and knowledge transfer

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Marlia de Dirceu Machado de Oliveira

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico
Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado da Bahia

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Laboratrio de Bioinformtica e Ecologia Microbiana

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Biocomplexity and Physical-Chemical-Biological Interactions in Multiple Scales in the Southwest Atlantic - PROANTAR 2019
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In an innovative way, the present project aims to relate turbulence patterns to certain phytoplankton types in order to elucidate the reasons why the Brazil-Malvinas Confluence (CBM) region is considered a 'hotspot' of phytoplantonic diversity. This initiative involves a joint effort between 11 institutions, 7 national (4 from the Northeast, 1 from the South and 2 from the Southeast) and 4 international (2 American, 1 Japanese and the other, Italian), whose main objective is to investigate, in a interdisciplinary, the role of physical-chemical and biological processes in the structuring of the planktonic ecosystem and in biogeochemical cycles in the CBM region, in order to test the hypothesis of the existence of greater diversity in regions where contour currents meet. This objective will be achieved through oceanic and atmospheric observations, numerical simulations and ecological theory involving the physical and biogeochemical parameters for the diagnosis and prediction of phytoplanktonic distribution, ecosystem dynamics as well as their response to climate changes in the environment in the Southwest Atlantic Ocean , focusing on CBM and its extension.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Laboratrio de Bioinformtica e Ecologia Microbiana

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecosystem services and environmental impacts in Todos os Santos Bay (SEImA-TSB)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project has a multidisciplinary and multi-institutional nature and is conceptualized as the third phase of the Todos os Santos Bay (TSB) Project, a long-term scientific program (30 years) that is about to turn ten years old. The great motivation for submitting this proposal, when continuing the TSB Project, is to evaluate, using multiple evidence lines, how stressors on a local / regional and global scale impact the ecosystems of Todos os Santos Bay. The specific objectives are: 1) To determine the efficiency and the storage time scale of organic and inorganic carbon, to evaluate the production and calcification processes in mangroves and seagrass and to determine the effect of human activities on C burial rates; 2) Determine key ecological processes and functions of mangroves and seagrass banks; 3) Establish the contamination chronology of different habitats, identifying sources and level of environmental degradation; 4) Quantify the contributions of technologically critical elements (e.g. rare earths) to the Bay; and 5) Investigate changes in TSB's circulation pattern. Thinking about these issues, this proposal brings together some of the main teaching and research institutions in the N and NE of Brazil that work in the area of ​​Marine Sciences, although it is not restricted to them only. The team is composed of senior researchers, in consolidation and in the beginning of the academic career, in a way that covers present and future competence. This project will involve scientific initiation, master's and doctoral students, who will develop their field and laboratory work in an integrated way with the researchers, allowing their academic training and the production of scientific articles that answer innovative questions. Renowned foreign researchers, participants in the proposal, assure that there will be collaborations with international reference groups, allowing the transfer of know-how, sharing of infrastructure and contribution to the internationalization of research activities. The results of this project will subsidize: i. the development of public policies related to environmental regulation, aiming at the sustainable use of BTS's natural resources; (ii) the preparation of the management plan for BTS's APA; (iii) the construction of biological, chemical and hydrographic databases for decision making regarding the planning of rural and urban development of the BTS drainage basin; (iv) the publication of scientific articles in high-impact magazines; and (v) the training of qualified human resources. As a technological innovation, the project foresees the valorization of lignocellulosic biomass residues collected in mangrove areas and seagrass banks with the potential to use these materials as adsorbents, both in natura, and after conversion to activated coals and magnetic coals, for the treatment of multiple effluents
